newsitem.title: USA: Dow slips losses to storm higher, NYSE curbs on.
newsitem.headline: Dow slips losses to storm higher, NYSE curbs on.

text.p: The Dow Jones Industrial Average shook off earlier losses this morning and stormed higher, with the Dow rising 51 points to 7746.

The gains prompted the New York Stock Exchange to set curbs on index-arbitrage trading curbs at 1521 EDT/1921 GMT, only about an hour after it took off the same curbs due to heavy losses in the blue chip average.
The Standard & Poor's 500 Index was up seven to about 908.
While those two indices of large, well-known companies shook off their earlier losses, the Nasdaq Composite Index and the Russell 2000 remained mired in modest losses.
The long bond was up 11/32 to yield 6.52 percent.

Analysts said the gains were made as some investors sought an entry point after Friday's losses. But many were still unsure of the short-term direction of blue chip stocks, accounting for today's see-sawing in equities.
The Dow started the session with gains of about 30 points before dipping to losses that prompted the earlier NYSE curbs on program trading.
